ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: You felt it best to avoid personal or social involvement with other people who are LGBQ
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: You have tried to stop being attracted to the same sex/gender
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: If someone offered you the chance to be completely heterosexual this past 3 months/past week, you would have accepted the offer
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: You have wished you weren't LGBQ
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: You have felt alienated from yourself because of being LGBQ
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: You have wished that you could develop more erotic feelings towards the opposite sex/gender
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: You have felt that being LGBQ+ is a personal shortcoming
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: You would have liked to get professional help in order to change your sexual orientation from LGBQ to straight
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: You have tried to become more sexually attracted to the opposite sex/gender
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Rarely; 3= Sometimes; 4= Often

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Internalized Homophobia Scale Mean Score
Patient Condition
Notes: 0 = Control; 1 = Self-Affirmation; 2 = Expressive Writing; -1 = Not applicable

ElementDescription: I wish I were not [lesbian/gay/bisexual/queer/or pansexual].
Notes: 1= Absolutely disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Cannot say; 4= Somewhat agree; 5= Absolutely agree; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I have tried to stop being attracted to people of the same gender in general.
Notes: 1= Absolutely disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Cannot say; 4= Somewhat agree; 5= Absolutely agree; 999= NA

ElementDescription: If someone offered me the chance to be completely heterosexual, I would accept the chance.
Notes: 1= Absolutely disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Cannot say; 4= Somewhat agree; 5= Absolutely agree; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I feel that being [lesbian/gay/bisexual/queer/or pansexual] is a personal shortcoming for me.
Notes: 1= Absolutely disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Cannot say; 4= Somewhat agree; 5= Absolutely agree; 999= NA

ElementDescription: I would like to get professional help in order to change my sexual orientation from [lesbian/gay/bisexual/queer/or pansexual] to straight.
Notes: 1= Absolutely disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Cannot say; 4= Somewhat agree; 5= Absolutely agree; 999= NA

ElementDescription: Internalized Homophobia Scale (Revised) - Average Score
Notes: Average of items istigma_sm_1 through 5

ElementDescription: I often feel it best to avoid personal or social involvement with other gay/bisexual men.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: I have tried to stop being attracted to men in general.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: If someone offered me the chance to be completely heterosexual, I would accept the chance.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: I wish I were not gay/bisexual.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: I feel alienated from myself because of being gay/bisexual.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: I wish that I could develop more erotic feelings about women.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: I feel that being gay/bisexual is a personal shortcoming for me.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: I would like to get professional help in order to change my sexual orientation from gay/bisexual to straight.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly

ElementDescription: I have tried to become more sexually attracted to women.
Notes: 1 = Disagree strongly; 2 = Disagree somewhat; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree somewhat; 5 = Agree strongly
